name: Ginger & Honey Tea
story: My grandmother in Georgia always gave us this tea at the first sign of a cold. It was warm, soothing, and made with love. She believed the warmth chased out â€œbad airâ€ and restored the bodyâ€™s balance. We were always told to rest after drinking it.
ritual: Before making the tea, she would pray over the boiling water and say, Let this bring breath and ease. She stirred it clockwise three times for healing and spoke the person's name.
cultural: This remedy was passed down from my Gullah-Geechee family in coastal South Carolina. Ginger was seen as a sacred root that stimulated energy and protected the spirit.
